00020 #define VALGRIND_COMPATIBLE
00021 
00022 #include <cassert>
00023 
00024 namespace boost {
00025 namespace xint {
00026 
00028 namespace detail {
00029 
00030 static const size_t datasize = (sizeof(data_t)+sizeof(digit_t)-1) /
00031     sizeof(digit_t);
00032 static const size_t minimum_digits = 1, digits_in_struct = 1;
00033 
00034 void zero(digit_t *p, digit_t *end) {
00035     while (p < end) *p++ = 0;
00036 }
00037 
00038 void zero(digit_t *p, size_t size) {
00039     zero(p, p + size);
00040 }
00041 
00042 data_t *allocate(size_t max_digits, size_t initial_length, digit_t mask) {
00043     max_digits = (std::max)(max_digits, minimum_digits);
00044     size_t count = max_digits - digits_in_struct + datasize;
00045 
00046     try {
00047         #ifdef VALGRIND_COMPATIBLE
00048             void *storage = malloc(count * sizeof(digit_t));
00049             data_t *r = new(storage) data_t;
00050         #else
00051             digit_t *storage(new digit_t[count]);
00052             data_t *r = new(reinterpret_cast<void*>(storage)) data_t;
00053         #endif
00054         r->copies=0;
00055         r->length=(std::min)(initial_length, max_digits);
00056         r->max_length=max_digits;
00057         r->fixed_mask=mask;
00058         zero(r->magnitude, r->length);
00059         return r;
00060     } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
00061         throw exceptions::overflow_error("Out of memory allocating integer");
00062     }
00063 }
00064 
00065 data_t *allocate_fixed(digit_t mask, size_t max_digits, size_t initial_length) {
00066     assert(mask != 0);
00067     return allocate(max_digits, initial_length, mask);
00068 }
00069 
00070 data_t *allocate_fixed_zero(digit_t mask, size_t max_digits) {
00071     data_t *r=allocate(max_digits, 1, mask);
00072     r->copies = 1;
00073     return r;
00074 }
00075 
00076 data_t *reallocate(data_t *olddata, size_t newsize) {
00077     if (olddata==0) {
00078         data_t *newdata=allocate(newsize);
00079         newdata->copies=1;
00080         return newdata;
00081     } else if (olddata->fixed_mask != 0) {
00082         // It's a fixed-size item, have to re-use it.
00083         newsize = (std::min)(newsize, olddata->max_length);
00084         if (olddata->length < newsize) zero(olddata->magnitude +
00085             olddata->length, olddata->magnitude + newsize);
00086         olddata->length = newsize;
00087         return olddata;
00088     } else if (olddata->copies == 1 && newsize <= olddata->max_length) {
00089         // We can re-use this data.
00090         if (olddata->length < newsize) zero(olddata->magnitude +
00091             olddata->length, olddata->magnitude + newsize);
00092         olddata->length = newsize;
00093         return olddata;
00094     } else {
00095         // Have to allocate new data.
00096         data_t *newdata=allocate(newsize, 0);
00097         newdata->copies = 1;
00098         newdata->length = newsize;
00099 
00100         digit_t *s = olddata->magnitude, *se = s + olddata->length,
00101             *t = newdata->magnitude, *te = t + newdata->length;
00102         while (s!=se) *t++ = *s++;
00103         zero(t, te);
00104 
00105         if (--olddata->copies == 0) deallocate(olddata);
00106         return newdata;
00107     }
00108 }
00109 
00110 void deallocate(data_t *data) {
00111     data->~data_t();
00112     digit_t *digits=reinterpret_cast<digit_t*>(data);
00113 
00114     #ifdef XINT_SECURE
00115     zero(digits, data->max_length + datasize - digits_in_struct);
00116     #endif
00117 
00118     #ifdef VALGRIND_COMPATIBLE
00119         free(digits);
00120     #else
00121         delete[] digits;
00122     #endif
00123 }

00126 // bitqueue_t functions

00128 void bitqueue_t::push(doubledigit_t bits, size_t count) {
00129     if (count < ddbits) {
00130         doubledigit_t mask = (doubledigit_t(1) << count) - 1;
00131         bits &= mask;
00132     }
00133 
00134     if (pending.empty()) {
00135         pending.push(std::make_pair(bits, count));
00136     } else {
00137         indata_t &n(pending.back());
00138         if (n.second + count <= ddbits) {
00139             n.first |= bits << n.second;
00140             n.second += count;
00141         } else {
00142             pending.push(std::make_pair(bits, count));
00143         }
00144     }
00145     bits_pending += count;
00146 }
00147 
00148 doubledigit_t bitqueue_t::pop(size_t requestedbits) {
00149     doubledigit_t buffer = 0;
00150     size_t bits_in_buffer = 0;
00151     while (bits_in_buffer < requestedbits && !pending.empty()) {
00152         indata_t &n(pending.front());
00153         size_t maxbits = requestedbits - bits_in_buffer, actualbits =
00154             (std::min)(n.second, maxbits);
00155         buffer |= (n.first << bits_in_buffer);
00156 
00157         n.first >>= actualbits;
00158         n.second -= actualbits;
00159         bits_in_buffer += actualbits;
00160         bits_pending -= actualbits;
00161 
00162         if (n.second == 0) pending.pop();
00163     }
00164     return (buffer & ((doubledigit_t(1) << requestedbits) - 1));
00165 }
